rule.name: MSHHH
rule.description: this is used for %#ok and should never be seen!

rule.name: BAIL
rule.description: done with run due to error

rule.name: NOLHS
rule.description: Left side of an assignment is empty.

rule.name: BDLEX
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: lexer returns unknown token.

rule.name: TMMSG
rule.description: More than 50,000 Code Analyzer messages were generated, leading to some being deleted.

rule.name: TMNOD
rule.description: Code Analyzer node table exceeded due to complexity of this program.

rule.name: MXASET
rule.description: Expression is too complex for code analysis to complete.

rule.name: NOMEM
rule.description: Code Analyzer has run out of memory.

rule.name: INERR
rule.description: An internal Code Analyzer consistency check has failed (Code Analyzer bug!).

rule.name: XJOIN
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: unexpected JOIN.

rule.name: NULLA
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: Null pointer in ASET.

rule.name: XOTHR
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: unexpected OTHERWISE.

rule.name: XELSE
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: unexpected ELSE.

rule.name: XCASE
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: unexpected CASE.

rule.name: XCTCH
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: unexpected CATCH.

rule.name: TOPLP
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: unexpected left parenthesis.

rule.name: TOPCL
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: call at top level.

rule.name: TMPAR
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: multiple parents for node.

rule.name: XTABL
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: table format error.

rule.name: XID
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: invalid ID index.

rule.name: XIDP
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: ID points to missing entry.

rule.name: XSTID
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: symbol table link is bad.

rule.name: XSTPT
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: symbol table list error.

rule.name: XNOU
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: missing use in table.

rule.name: XQUOT
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: unexpected quote in table.

rule.name: NOUSE
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: Cannot find source of use conflict.

rule.name: NOLST
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: missing list entry.

rule.name: NONUK
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: unexpected need to remove quote.

rule.name: NODS
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: data structure corruption.

rule.name: XVAR2
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: linking var twice.

rule.name: XCALL
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: unexpected CALL.

rule.name: XDCAL
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: unexpected DCALL.

rule.name: XSB2E
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: subscript seen too early.

rule.name: XDOPE
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: dope field seen for non-ID.

rule.name: XDUAL
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: Dual data structure error.

rule.name: XFOR
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: badly constructed FOR.

rule.name: XUPLV
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: missing list in uplevel.

rule.name: UPFCN
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: uplevel of function defn.

rule.name: XTREE
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: bad parse tree.

rule.name: XTRCL
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: bad tree turning to call.

rule.name: XMISS
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: no missing entries in scripts.

rule.name: XOUT
rule.description: Code Analyzer bug: bad outer scope entry.

rule.name: LIN2L
rule.description: A source file line is too long for Code Analyzer.

rule.name: QUIT
rule.description: Earlier syntax errors confused Code Analyzer (or a possible Code Analyzer bug).

rule.name: NOSPC
rule.description: File <FILE> is too large or complex to analyze.

rule.name: MBIG
rule.description: File <FILE> is too big for Code Analyzer to handle.

rule.name: NOFIL
rule.description: File <FILE> cannot be opened for reading.

rule.name: NOFWR
rule.description: File <FILE> cannot be opened for writing.

rule.name: MDOTM
rule.description: Filename <FILE> must be a valid MATLAB code file.

rule.name: BDFIL
rule.description: Filename <FILE> is not formed from a valid MATLAB identifier.

rule.name: RDERR
rule.description: Unable to read file <FILE>.

rule.name: MCDIR
rule.description: Class name <name> and @directory name do not agree: <FILE>.

rule.name: MCFIL
rule.description: Class name <name> and file name do not agree: <file>.

rule.name: CFERR
rule.description: Cannot open or read the Code Analyzer settings from file <FILE>. Using default settings instead.

rule.name: BDOPT
rule.description: Option <name> is ignored because it is invalid.

rule.name: BADCH
rule.description: Invalid character(s).

rule.name: BADFP
rule.description: Invalid floating-point constant.

rule.name: BADOT
rule.description: Use of two dots (..) is an invalid MATLAB construction.

rule.name: STRIN
rule.description: A quoted string is unterminated.

rule.name: INBLK
rule.description: A block comment is unterminated at the end of the file.

rule.name: RESWD
rule.description: Invalid use of a reserved word.

rule.name: REDEF
rule.description: <name> might be used incompatibly or redefined.

rule.name: UNSET
rule.description: Invalid use of <operator> on the left side of an assignment.

rule.name: LHROW
rule.description: The left side of an assignment cannot have multiple rows (';').

rule.name: EOFER
rule.description: Program might end prematurely (or an earlier error confused Code Analyzer).

rule.name: MDEEP
rule.description: Parentheses, brackets, and braces are nested too deeply.

rule.name: DEEPC
rule.description: Block comments are nested too deeply.

rule.name: DEEPN
rule.description: Functions are nested too deeply.

rule.name: DEEPS
rule.description: Statements are nested too deeply.

rule.name: NOPAR
rule.description: Invalid syntax at <operator>. Possibly, a ), }, or ] is missing.

rule.name: TWOCM
rule.description: A comma cannot immediately follow another comma.

rule.name: ROWLN
rule.description: All matrix rows must be the same length.

rule.name: COLND
rule.description: END or Colon can only be used to index arrays. This might be an incorrect use.

rule.name: NOCLS
rule.description: DOT in function name is only valid in methods of a class

rule.name: GPFST
rule.description: A GLOBAL or PERSISTENT declaration must precede first use.

rule.name: NPERS
rule.description: A PERSISTENT declaration is not valid in scripts.

rule.name: DSARG
rule.description: The DRANGE function must have 1, 2, or 3 arguments.

rule.name: FNEST
rule.description: FUNCTION keyword use is invalid here. This might cause later messages about END.

rule.name: ENDCT
rule.description: An END might be missing, possibly matching <reserved word>.

rule.name: SYNER
rule.description: Parse error at <reserved word>: usage might be invalid MATLAB syntax.

rule.name: SBTMP
rule.description: Cannot call or index into a temporary array.

rule.name: CFIG
rule.description: The Code Analyzer settings file, <FILE>, has an error on line <line #>.

rule.name: BADNOT
rule.description: Using ~ to ignore a value is not permitted in this context.

rule.name: ENDPAR
rule.description: Invalid syntax at end of file. Possibly, the indicated bracket is not matched.

rule.name: PFRNG
rule.description: The range of a PARFOR statement must be increasing consecutive integers.

rule.name: PFNST
rule.description: PARFOR or SPMD cannot be used inside another PARFOR loop.

rule.name: PFDF
rule.description: FOR with DRANGE (old PARFOR) cannot be used inside a PARFOR loop.

rule.name: PFBR
rule.description: BREAK and RETURN statements cannot be used inside a PARFOR loop.

rule.name: PFLD
rule.description: The LOAD function can only be used to assign an output structure in a PARFOR loop.

rule.name: PFSV
rule.description: SAVE cannot be called in a PARFOR loop.

rule.name: PFGP
rule.description: The GLOBAL or PERSISTENT variable <name> should not be set inside a PARFOR loop.

rule.name: PFGV
rule.description: Using GLOBAL variable <name> in a PARFOR loop could fail because it accesses a worker machine's global area.

rule.name: PFEVB
rule.description: Using EVALIN('base') or ASSIGNIN('base') inside a PARFOR loop refers to the worker machines' base workspaces.

rule.name: PFEVC
rule.description: EVALIN('caller') and ASSIGNIN('caller') are invalid inside of a PARFOR loop.

rule.name: PFNAIO
rule.description: <NAME> with zero input arguments should not be used inside a PARFOR loop.

rule.name: PFNACK
rule.description: <NAME> should not be used inside a PARFOR loop.

rule.name: PFUIX
rule.description: The index variable <name> might be used after the PARFOR loop, but it is unavailable after the loop.

rule.name: PFOUS
rule.description: The output variable <name> might not be used after the PARFOR loop.

rule.name: PFIIN
rule.description: The input variable <name> should be initialized before the PARFOR loop.

rule.name: PFUNK
rule.description: The PARFOR loop cannot run due to the way variable <name> is used.

rule.name: PFRIN
rule.description: The reduction variable <name> might not be set before the PARFOR loop.

rule.name: PFRUS
rule.description: The reduction variable <name> might not be used after the PARFOR loop.

rule.name: PFPIE
rule.description: Valid indices for <name> are restricted in PARFOR loops.

rule.name: PFBNS
rule.description: The entire array or structure <name> is a broadcast variable. This might result in unnecessary communication overhead.

rule.name: PFSAME
rule.description: In a PARFOR loop, variable <name> is indexed in different ways, potentially causing dependencies between iterations.

rule.name: PFTIN
rule.description: The temporary variable <name> uses a value set outside of the PARFOR loop.

rule.name: PFBFN
rule.description: The function <NAME> inside a PARFOR loop might not access the correct workspace.

rule.name: PFIFN
rule.description: The function <NAME> might make an invalid workspace access inside the PARFOR loop.

rule.name: PFNF
rule.description: The nested function <NAME> cannot be called from within a PARFOR loop.

rule.name: PFTUS
rule.description: The temporary variable <name> is used after the PARFOR loop, but its value is not available after the loop.

rule.name: PFRNC
rule.description: The variable <name> is used like a PARFOR reduction variable, but it has additional (invalid) uses.

rule.name: PFRFH
rule.description: The PARFOR reduction function <NAME> must either be a function name or a broadcast variable.

rule.name: FORFLG
rule.description: Problems would result if this FOR keyword were replaced by PARFOR.

rule.name: FORPF
rule.description: This FOR loop might be a candidate for conversion to a PARFOR loop.

rule.name: PFXST
rule.description: Changing the loop index <name> is invalid inside a PARFOR loop.

rule.name: PFCODN
rule.description: Because the variable <name> is or contains a distributed or codistributed variable, it is invalid inside a PARFOR loop.

rule.name: PFCODA
rule.description: Because this expression appears to be or contain a distributed or codistributed variable, it is invalid inside a PARFOR loop.

rule.name: PFCMPN
rule.description: Because the variable <name> is or contains a Composite, it is invalid inside a PARFOR loop.

rule.name: PFCMPA
rule.description: Because this expression appears to be or contain a Composite, it is invalid inside a PARFOR loop.

rule.name: SPDEC
rule.description: The bounds on the number of workers an SPMD block can use must be a positive integer.

rule.name: SPDEC3
rule.description: An SPMD block can only specify a lower and upper bound for the number of workers to use.

rule.name: SPNST
rule.description: PARFOR or SPMD cannot be used inside an SPMD block.

rule.name: SPRET
rule.description: <reserved word> statement cannot be used inside an SPMD block.

rule.name: SPBRK
rule.description: The loop containing the BREAK or CONTINUE must be completely contained in the SPMD block.

rule.name: SPLD
rule.description: In an SPMD block, the only valid use of the LOAD function is to assign to an output structure.

rule.name: SPSV
rule.description: SAVE cannot be called in an SPMD block.

rule.name: SPGP
rule.description: Setting the GLOBAL or PERSISTENT variable <name> in an SPMD block might fail because the set happens on a worker machine.

rule.name: SPGV
rule.description: Using the GLOBAL or PERSISTENT variable <name> in an SPMD block might fail because it is accessed on a worker machine.

rule.name: SPEVB
rule.description: Using EVALIN('base') or ASSIGNIN('base') inside an SPMD block refers to the worker machines' base workspaces.

rule.name: SPEVC
rule.description: EVALIN('caller') and ASSIGNIN('caller') are invalid inside of an SPMD block.

rule.name: SPBFN
rule.description: The function <NAME> inside an SPMD block might not access the desired workspace.

rule.name: SPIFN
rule.description: The function <NAME> might make an invalid workspace access inside the SPMD block.

rule.name: SPNF
rule.description: The nested function <NAME> cannot be called from within an SPMD block.

rule.name: DCMIX
rule.description: The operator <operator> appears to combine distributed and codistributed values.

rule.name: SPCN
rule.description: Container <name> should not be used inside an SPMD block because it is hiding a Composite, distributed, or codistributed variable.

rule.name: SPCNC
rule.description: This cell array should not be used inside an SPMD block because it is hiding a Composite, distributed, or codistributed variable.

rule.name: SPICN
rule.description: The variable <name> contains a hidden Composite, distributed, or codistributed variable and therefore should not be used inside an SPMD block.

rule.name: SPCCO
rule.description: Because the variable <name> contains a hidden codistributed variable, it should not be used outside an SPMD block.

rule.name: DSPMDN
rule.description: The variable <name> appears to be distributed, but is created inside an SPMD block.

rule.name: DSPMDA
rule.description: This expression appears to create a distributed value inside an SPMD block.

rule.name: DCUNK
rule.description: The codistributed or distributed array static function <name> is unrecognized.

rule.name: FSPMDN
rule.description: The variable <name> appears to be set to a codistributed value outside of an SPMD block.

rule.name: FSPMDA
rule.description: This expression appears to create a codistributed value outside of an SPMD block.

rule.name: SPWHOS
rule.description: The <NAME> function cannot be called from within an SPMD block.

rule.name: NOEFF
rule.description: The operation or expression <operator> has no evident effect.

rule.name: NUSED
rule.description: Global or persistent variable <name> might be unused or unset in this function or script.

rule.name: NOANS
rule.description: Using ANS as a variable is not recommended as ANS is frequently overwritten by MATLAB.

rule.name: PUSE
rule.description: Persistent variable <name> might be unused.

rule.name: USENS
rule.description: Variable <name> is used, but might be unset.

rule.name: SUSENS
rule.description: Variable <name> is used, but might be unset (within a script).

rule.name: SETNU
rule.description: Variable <name> is set, but might be unused.

rule.name: ASGLU
rule.description: The value assigned here to <name> appears to be unused. Consider replacing it by ~.

rule.name: NASGU
rule.description: The value assigned to variable <name> might be unused.

rule.name: PREALL
rule.description: The variable <name> appears to be preallocated, but preallocation is not recommended here.

rule.name: SNASGU
rule.description: The value assigned to variable <name> might be unused (within the script).

rule.name: NODEF
rule.description: The variable <name> might be used before it is defined.

rule.name: INUSD
rule.description: Input argument <name> might be unused. If this is OK, consider replacing it by ~.

rule.name: VANUS
rule.description: Input argument 'varargin' might be unused.

rule.name: INUSL
rule.description: Input argument <name> might be unused, although a later one is used. Consider replacing it by ~.

rule.name: DEFNU
rule.description: The function <name> might be unused.

rule.name: VALST
rule.description: <name> must be the last argument in the argument list.

rule.name: ASGSL
rule.description: Assignment to <name> might be unnecessary.

rule.name: UNRCH
rule.description: This statement (and possibly following ones) cannot be reached.

rule.name: PROP
rule.description: There is a property named <name>. Did you mean to reference it?

rule.name: CPROP
rule.description: Confusing function call. Did you mean to reference property <name>?

rule.name: COMNL
rule.description: Comma before newline might incorrectly suggest row continuation.

rule.name: FXSET
rule.description: Loop index <name> is changed inside of a FOR loop.

rule.name: FXUP
rule.description: Outer loop index <name> is set inside a child function.

rule.name: STRSZ
rule.description: Comparing two strings that might have different sizes. Use STRCMP.

rule.name: M3COL
rule.description: Using three colons (a:b:c:d) in an expression is probably unintended.

rule.name: BDLOG
rule.description: Operator <operator> is seldom used in a logical context.

rule.name: BDSCA
rule.description: Operator <operator> is seldom used in a scalar context.

rule.name: BDLGI
rule.description: Variable <name> might be set by a nonlogical operator.

rule.name: BDSCI
rule.description: Variable <name> might be set by a nonscalar operator.

rule.name: DUALC
rule.description: Command <name> might be prematurely ended by comma.

rule.name: RHSFN
rule.description: The expression cannot be assigned to multiple values.

rule.name: STOUT
rule.description: The function return value <name> might be unset.

rule.name: LTARG
rule.description: Function <NAME> might be called with too few arguments.

rule.name: GTARG
rule.description: Function <NAME> might be called with too many arguments.

rule.name: CTPCT
rule.description: The format string might not agree with the argument count.

rule.name: FNAN
rule.description: Use ISNAN when comparing values to NaN.

rule.name: NOSEM
rule.description: Extra semicolon is unnecessary.

rule.name: NOCOM
rule.description: Extra comma is unnecessary.

rule.name: TRYNC
rule.description: TRY statement should have a CATCH statement to check for unexpected errors.

rule.name: NO4LP
rule.description: Parentheses are not needed in a FOR statement.

rule.name: FNDEF
rule.description: Function name <name> is known to MATLAB by its file name: <file>.

rule.name: CTCH
rule.description: Best practice is for CATCH to be followed by an identifier that gets the error information.

rule.name: PSTAT
rule.description: The 'Static' attribute is invalid on properties. Use 'Constant' instead.

rule.name: CTORO
rule.description: Class constructors must be declared with at least one output argument.

rule.name: NOIN
rule.description: Method <name> is not Static, so it must have at least one input argument.

rule.name: MANU
rule.description: Argument <name> is unused. Should this method be Static?

rule.name: MHERM
rule.description: Parenthesize the multiplication of <name> and its transpose to ensure the result is Hermitian.

rule.name: MOCUP
rule.description: The variable <name> is an uplevel variable, invalid in a function called by onCleanup.

rule.name: MDUPC
rule.description: The case value <name> is a duplicate of one on line <line #>.

rule.name: MNANC
rule.description: NaN never compares equal to any value, so this case will never be matched.

rule.name: MULCC
rule.description: This case cannot be matched due to a call to UPPER or LOWER on the SWITCH value.

rule.name: RMWRN
rule.description: The warning with tag <name> has been removed from MATLAB, so this statement has no effect.

rule.name: UNONC
rule.description: Assign the onCleanup output argument to a variable. Do not use the tilde operator (~) in place of a variable.

rule.name: CHAIN
rule.description: Use (<name> <name> <name>) && (<name> <name> <name>) instead of (<name> <name> <name> <name> <name>) to test if <name> is between <name> and <name>.

rule.name: DISPLAY
rule.description: Overloading DISPLAY is not recommended.

rule.name: SUBSINDEX
rule.description: Do not overload SUBSINDEX for fundamental data types.

rule.name: VARARG
rule.description: Initialize VARARGOUT with a CELL.

rule.name: SUBSASGN
rule.description: Output of SUBSASGN must be assigned to a variable.

rule.name: CLEARSCRIPT
rule.description: For improved performance, consider not using CLEAR <NAME> within a script.

rule.name: CLEARFUNCTION
rule.description: CLEAR <NAME> should only be used in a script.

rule.name: BRKCONT
rule.description: <NAME> can only be used in a FOR or WHILE loop..

rule.name: ATTF
rule.description: The attribute value <name> is unexpected. Use "true" or "false" instead.

rule.name: ATPPP
rule.description: The attribute value <name> is unexpected. Use "public", "private", "protected", or a cell array of meta-classes instead.

rule.name: ATPPI
rule.description: The attribute value <name> is unexpected. Use "public", "private", "protected", "immutable", or a cell array of meta-classes instead.

rule.name: ATCA
rule.description: The attribute value <name> is unexpected. Use a cell array of meta-class objects instead.

rule.name: ATNPP
rule.description: Set attribute <name> to "public", "private", "protected", or a cell array of meta-classes instead.

rule.name: ATNPI
rule.description: Set attribute <name> to "public", "private", "protected", "immutable", or a cell array of meta-classes instead.

rule.name: ATNCA
rule.description: Set attribute <name> to a cell array of meta-class objects.

rule.name: ATAS
rule.description: The attribute value <name> is unexpected. Use a single meta-class object or a cell array of meta-class objects.

rule.name: ATNAS
rule.description: Set attribute <name> to a single meta-class object or a cell array of meta-class objects.

rule.name: ATUNK
rule.description: Unknown attribute name <name>.

rule.name: ATVIZ
rule.description: Attribute 'Visible' is spelled '~Hidden' in MATLAB, and is the default.

rule.name: ATTOF
rule.description: Setting the class attribute Abstract to false is not recommended.

rule.name: ATTO
rule.description: The attribute value <name> is unexpected. Use "true" or "false" instead.

rule.name: CLTWO
rule.description: Only one class definition is allowed per file, and it must come at the head of the file.

rule.name: NOPRV
rule.description: A class definition cannot be inside a private directory.

rule.name: MCHV1
rule.description: Conflict between handle and value class usage (lines <line #> and <line #>).

rule.name: MCHV2
rule.description: Probable conflict between handle and value class usage (lines <line #> and <line #>).

rule.name: MCHV3
rule.description: Possible conflict between handle and value class usage (lines <line #> and <line #>).

rule.name: MCVC
rule.description: The class <NAME> has no superclasses, so must be value class (line <line #>).

rule.name: MCHC
rule.description: The class <name> is derived from a handle class, so must be a handle class (line <line #>).

rule.name: MCEB
rule.description: The class has an <reserved word> block, so must be a handle class (line <line #>).

rule.name: MCDEL
rule.description: The class has a <NAME> method, so is likely to be a handle class (line <line #>).

rule.name: MCHM
rule.description: A property is set in object <NAME>, but the modified object is not used or returned, implying that this class is a handle class (line <line #>).

rule.name: MCVM
rule.description: Method <NAME> sets a property and returns the modified object, implying that the class is a value class (line <line #>).

rule.name: MCSGP
rule.description: The method <NAME> does not refer to a valid property name.

rule.name: MCSGA
rule.description: Set/Get method <NAME> must be defined in a METHODS block with no attributes.

rule.name: MCS2I
rule.description: Set Methods must have exactly two inputs.

rule.name: MCS1O
rule.description: Set Methods must have at most one output.

rule.name: MCG1I
rule.description: Get methods must have exactly one input.

rule.name: MCG1O
rule.description: Get methods must have exactly one output.

rule.name: MCPO
rule.description: The property <NAME> is observable, which implies the class is a handle class (line <line #>).

rule.name: MCGSA
rule.description: Method <NAME> tries to set or get an abstract property.

rule.name: MCSCN
rule.description: Method <NAME> tries to set a constant property.

rule.name: MCANI
rule.description: Abstract property <name> cannot be initialized.

rule.name: MCASC
rule.description: Abstract property <name> cannot be used in a Sealed class.

rule.name: MCCPI
rule.description: The Constant property <name> needs to be initialized.

rule.name: MCSH
rule.description: Method <NAME> has a signature consistent with a handle class (line <line #>).

rule.name: MCSV
rule.description: Method <NAME> has a signature consistent with a value class (line <line #>).

rule.name: MCCBD
rule.description: The constructor <NAME> must be fully defined in the class definition file.

rule.name: MCPSG
rule.description: The set/get function <NAME> must be fully defined in the class definition file.

rule.name: MCSCT
rule.description: A call to a superclass constructor must appear at the top level (not conditional) in a constructor.

rule.name: MCSCO
rule.description: A superclass constructor must be called using the first constructor output argument.

rule.name: MCSCF
rule.description: A superclass constructor must be assigned to the first constructor output argument.

rule.name: MCCBS
rule.description: A superclass constructor is being called, but <NAME> is not a declared superclass name.

rule.name: MCCBU
rule.description: This superclass constructor is called after a use of the constructed object.

rule.name: MCCMC
rule.description: The constructor for superclass <NAME> can only be called once.

rule.name: MCSCM
rule.description: In this call of a superclass method, <NAME> must match the name of the method in which it is used.

rule.name: MCNPN
rule.description: <name> is referenced but is not a property, method, or event name defined in this class.

rule.name: MCNPR
rule.description: <name> is not a property, but is the target of an assignment.

rule.name: MCCPE
rule.description: Attempting to call a property or event <NAME> as a function.

rule.name: MCSUP
rule.description: A set method for a non-Dependent property should not access another property (<name>).

rule.name: MCCSP
rule.description: '<name>.<name>' creates a struct named <name> with a field named <name>, matching the names of the class and constant property.

rule.name: MTMAT
rule.description: The attribute <name> cannot be set more than once.

rule.name: MTAGS
rule.description: Cannot use the <name> attribute when using the <name> attribute.

rule.name: MCSAC
rule.description: SetAccess cannot be set on Constant properties.

rule.name: MCSNO
rule.description: Set method's first argument <name> is not returned, implying a handle class.

rule.name: MCAPP
rule.description: The private property <name> cannot be Abstract.

rule.name: MCMSP
rule.description: The private method <name> cannot be Abstract.

rule.name: MHERIT
rule.description: Deriving from the built-in MATLAB <name> class is not supported.

rule.name: MCSWA
rule.description: A sealed class cannot specify allowed subclasses.

rule.name: MOBSRV
rule.description: Using SetObservable or GetObservable on a Constant property has no effect.

rule.name: SPERR
rule.description: ERROR takes SPRINTF-like arguments directly.

rule.name: SPWRN
rule.description: WARNING takes SPRINTF-like arguments directly.

rule.name: NCHKOS
rule.description: NARGINCHK does not return any values.

rule.name: NCHKE
rule.description: Use NARGOUTCHK without ERROR.

rule.name: WLAST
rule.description: WARNING('') does not reset the warning state. Use LASTWARN('') instead.

rule.name: WNON
rule.description: WARNING('ON',msgID) is faster than WARNING('ON').

rule.name: WNOFF
rule.description: WARNING('OFF',msgID) is faster than WARNING('OFF').

rule.name: WNTAG
rule.description: The first argument of WARNING should be a message identifier. Using a message identifier allows users better control over the message.

rule.name: ERTAG
rule.description: The first argument of ERROR should be a message identifier.

rule.name: ERTXT
rule.description: Specify an error message with the message identifier.

rule.name: WTXT
rule.description: Specify a warning message with the message identifier.

rule.name: STCI
rule.description: Use STRCMPI(str1,str2) instead of using UPPER/LOWER in a call to STRCMP.

rule.name: STLOW
rule.description: There is no need for UPPER/LOWER in this string comparison.

rule.name: STCUL
rule.description: The string comparison will likely fail due to upper/lower case mismatch.

rule.name: STISA
rule.description: Consider using ISA instead of comparing the class to a string.

rule.name: PFCEL
rule.description: The function <NAME> is apparently called with a cell array (argument <line #>).

rule.name: STRNU
rule.description: Variable <name>, apparently a structure, is changed but the value seems to be unused.

rule.name: ITERS
rule.description: The Code Analyzer type analysis may be incorrect here.

rule.name: TLEV
rule.description: <reserved word> could be very inefficient unless it is a top-level statement in its function.

rule.name: RGXP1
rule.description: Using REGEXP(string, pattern, 'ONCE') is faster in this case.

rule.name: TRIM1
rule.description: Use STRTRIM(str) instead of nesting FLIPLR and DEBLANK calls.

rule.name: STTOK
rule.description: Use one call to TEXTSCAN instead of calling STRTOK in a loop.

rule.name: TRIM2
rule.description: Use STRTRIM(str) instead of DEBLANK(STRJUST(str,'left')).

rule.name: STNCI
rule.description: Use STRNCMPI(str1,str2) instead of using UPPER/LOWER in a call to STRNCMP.

rule.name: STCCS
rule.description: It appears that STRCMPI/STRNCMPI can be replaced by a faster, case sensitive compare.

rule.name: FLUDLR
rule.description: It appears that flipud(fliplr(x)) or fliplr(flipud(x)) can be replaced by a faster rot90(x,2).

rule.name: RPMT0
rule.description: Consider replacing repmat(0,x,y) with zeros(x,y) for better performance.

rule.name: RPMT1
rule.description: Consider replacing repmat(1,x,y) with ones(x,y) for better performance.

rule.name: RPMTN
rule.description: Consider replacing repmat(NaN,x,y) with NaN(x,y) for better performance.

rule.name: RPMTF
rule.description: Consider replacing repmat(false,x,y) with false(x,y) for better performance.

rule.name: RPMTT
rule.description: Consider replacing repmat(true,x,y) with true(x,y) for better performance.

rule.name: RPMTI
rule.description: Consider replacing repmat(Inf,x,y) with Inf(x,y) for better performance.

rule.name: PSIZE
rule.description: NUMEL(x) is usually faster than PROD(SIZE(x)).

rule.name: FNDSB
rule.description: If <name> is an indexed variable, performance can be improved using logical indexing instead of FIND.

rule.name: SFLD
rule.description: Use dynamic fieldnames with structures instead of SETFIELD.

rule.name: GFLD
rule.description: Use dynamic fieldnames with structures instead of GETFIELD.

rule.name: CCAT
rule.description: { A{:} B } can often be replaced by [ A {B}], which can be much faster.

rule.name: AGROW
rule.description: The variable <name> appears to change size on every loop iteration. Consider preallocating for speed.

rule.name: SAGROW
rule.description: The variable <name> appears to change size on every loop iteration (within a script). Consider preallocating for speed.

rule.name: ISMT
rule.description: Using ISEMPTY is usually faster than comparing LENGTH to 0.

rule.name: LOGL
rule.description: Use TRUE or FALSE instead of LOGICAL(1) or LOGICAL(0).

rule.name: ST2NM
rule.description: STR2DOUBLE is faster than STR2NUM; however, STR2DOUBLE operates only on scalars. Use the function that best suits your needs.

rule.name: FLPST
rule.description: For better performance in some cases, use SORT with the 'descend' option.

rule.name: MXFND
rule.description: Use FIND with the 'first' or 'last' option.

rule.name: EFIND
rule.description: To improve performance, replace ISEMPTY(FIND(X)) with ISEMPTY(FIND( X, 1 )).

rule.name: EXIST
rule.description: EXIST with two input arguments is generally faster and clearer than with one input argument.

rule.name: UDIM
rule.description: Instead of using transpose ('), consider using a different DIMENSION input argument to <NAME>.

rule.name: ISCHR
rule.description: Use ISCHAR instead of comparing the class to 'char'.

rule.name: ISSTR
rule.description: Use ISSTRUCT instead of comparing the class to 'struct'.

rule.name: ISLOG
rule.description: Use ISLOGICAL instead of comparing the class to 'logical'.

rule.name: ISCEL
rule.description: Use ISCELL instead of comparing the class to 'cell'.

rule.name: MIPC1
rule.description: On Windows platforms, calling COMPUTER with an argument returns 'win32' or 'win64', but never 'PCWIN'.

rule.name: STFLD
rule.description: SETFIELD output must be assigned back to the structure.

rule.name: RMFLD
rule.description: RMFIELD output must be assigned back to the structure.

rule.name: FREAD
rule.description: FREAD(FID,...,'*char') is more efficient than CHAR(FREAD(...)).

rule.name: N2UNI
rule.description: FREAD no longer requires NATIVE2UNICODE in R2006A and later releases.

rule.name: TNMLP
rule.description: Consider moving the toolbox function <NAME> out of the loop for better performance.

rule.name: IJCL
rule.description: Replace complex i and j by 1i for speed and improved robustness.

rule.name: MINV
rule.description: INV(A)*b can be slower and less accurate than A\b. Consider using A\b for INV(A)*b or b/A for b*INV(A).

rule.name: LAXES
rule.description: Calling AXES(h) in a loop can be slow. Consider moving the call to AXES outside the loop.

rule.name: MMTC
rule.description: This use of MAT2CELL should probably be replaced by a simpler, faster call to NUM2CELL.

rule.name: MRPBW
rule.description: To use less memory, replace BWLABEL(bw) by LOGICAL(bw) in a call of REGIONPROPS.

rule.name: SPRIX
rule.description: This sparse indexing expression is likely to be slow.

rule.name: SPEIG
rule.description: The <NAME> function is called in an invalid manner with a sparse argument.

rule.name: TRSRT
rule.description: Transposing the input to <NAME> is often unnecessary.

rule.name: CCAT1
rule.description: { A{I} } can usually be replaced by A(I) or A(I)', which can be much faster.

rule.name: GRIDD
rule.description: Consider replacing GRIDDATA with SCATTEREDINTERPOLANT for better performance.

rule.name: ISMAT
rule.description: When checking if a variable is a matrix consider using ISMATRIX.

rule.name: ISROW
rule.description: When checking if a variable is a row vector consider using ISROW.

rule.name: ISCOL
rule.description: When checking if a variable is a column vector consider using ISCOLUMN.

rule.name: EMAO
rule.description: Code generation does not support & and

rule.name: EMCA
rule.description: Code generation only supports cell operations for varargin and varargout.

rule.name: EMTC
rule.description: Code generation does not support TRY/CATCH constructions.

rule.name: EMSCR
rule.description: Code generation does not support scripts.

rule.name: EMNST
rule.description: Code generation does not support nested functions.

rule.name: EMFH
rule.description: Code generation does not support anonymous functions.

rule.name: EMVDF
rule.description: Code generation requires variable <name> to be fully defined before subscripting it.

rule.name: EMGRO
rule.description: Code generation does not support variable <name> size growth through indexing.

rule.name: EMNSI
rule.description: Code generation requires IF and WHILE conditions to be scalar.

rule.name: EMTAG
rule.description: The compilation directive (or pragma) EML is not recommended. Use CODEGEN instead.

rule.name: EMXTR
rule.description: The EML package is not recommended. Use CODER instead.

rule.name: MCAP
rule.description: MCC does not permit the ADDPATH function.

rule.name: MCCD
rule.description: MCC use of the CD function is problematic.

rule.name: MCPRD
rule.description: MCC allows only one argument in the PRINTDLG function.

rule.name: MCPRT
rule.description: MCC prefers Windows applications to call DEPLOYPRINT instead of PRINT, but use PRINT when printing to a file.

rule.name: MCHLP
rule.description: MCC does not permit the HELP function.

rule.name: MCKBD
rule.description: MCC does not permit the KEYBOARD function.

rule.name: MCSVP
rule.description: MCC does not permit the SAVEPATH function.

rule.name: MCMLR
rule.description: MCC use of the MATLABROOT function is problematic.

rule.name: MCDP
rule.description: MCC use of the DEPLOYPRINT function is problematic.

rule.name: MCABF
rule.description: MCC use of absolute file names is likely to fail.

rule.name: MCMFL
rule.description: MCC allows writing .m files, but they cannot be executed by the deployed application.

rule.name: MCTBX
rule.description: MCC use of toolbox folder file names is likely to fail.

rule.name: MCUOA
rule.description: MCC requires the program to assign a value to output argument <name>.

rule.name: MCLL
rule.description: MCC does not allow C++ files to be read directly using LOADLIBRARY.

rule.name: MCWBF
rule.description: MCC requires that the first argument of WEBFIGURE not come from FIGURE(n).

rule.name: MCWFL
rule.description: MCC requires that the first argument of WEBFIGURE not come from FIGURE(n) (line <line #>).

rule.name: DSPS
rule.description: DISP(SPRINTF(...)) can usually be replaced by FPRINTF(...).

rule.name: SEPEX
rule.description: For better readability, use newline, semicolon, or comma before this statement.

rule.name: NBRAK
rule.description: Use of brackets [] is unnecessary. Use parentheses to group, if needed.

rule.name: ALIGN
rule.description: <reserved word> might not be aligned with its matching END (line <line #>).

rule.name: AND2
rule.description: Use && instead of & as the AND operator in (scalar) conditional statements.

rule.name: OR2
rule.description: Use

rule.name: NOPTS
rule.description: Terminate statement with semicolon to suppress output (within a script).

rule.name: NOPRT
rule.description: Terminate statement with semicolon to suppress output (in functions).

rule.name: VUNUS
rule.description: <operator> produces a value that might be unused.

rule.name: LNGNM
rule.description: The name <name> has been truncated to 63 characters.

rule.name: MFAMB
rule.description: Code Analyzer cannot determine whether <name> is a variable or a function, and assumes it is a function.

rule.name: MSNU
rule.description: A Code Analyzer message was once suppressed here, but the message is no longer generated.

rule.name: DNNW
rule.description: DATENUM(NOW) can be replaced by NOW.

rule.name: LIC3
rule.description: In test files, use "qeLicense" instead of LICENSE.

rule.name: APWT
rule.description: In test files, use "qePoll" instead of APWAIT.

rule.name: PRTCAL
rule.description: Terminate call to <NAME> with semicolon to suppress output to command window.

rule.name: NCOMMA
rule.description: Best practice is to separate output variables with commas.

rule.name: NSTMT
rule.description: The function <name> has <line #> statements.

rule.name: NSSMT
rule.description: This script has <line #> statements.

rule.name: CABE
rule.description: The McCabe complexity of <name> is <line #>.

rule.name: SCABE
rule.description: The McCabe complexity is <line #>.

rule.name: LERR
rule.description: LASTERR and LASTERROR are not recommended. Use an identifier on the CATCH block instead.

rule.name: EVLC
rule.description: Using EVAL and EVALC with two arguments is not recommended. Use TRY/CATCH instead.

rule.name: RAND
rule.description: RAND and RANDN will not accept 'seed', 'state', or 'twister' in a future release.

rule.name: NOV6
rule.description: The 'v6' flag will be removed in <NAME> in a future release. There is no simple replacement for this.

rule.name: V6ON
rule.description: USEV6PLOTAPI('on') will be removed in a future release. There is no simple replacement for this.

rule.name: HOUGH
rule.description: HOUGH(BW,'ThetaResolution',VAL) is not recommended. Use HOUGH(BW,'Theta',-90:VAL:(90-VAL) ) instead.

rule.name: FROPT
rule.description: Option <NAME> will be removed in a future release. Use <name> instead.

rule.name: FROPTX
rule.description: Option <NAME> will be removed in a future release. There is no simple replacement for this.

rule.name: DPSD
rule.description: <NAME> is not recommended. Use <NAME> instead.

rule.name: VRRPS
rule.description: VIDEOREADER.ISPLATFORMSUPPORTED has been removed. VIDEOREADER is now supported on all platforms.

rule.name: DMMR
rule.description: <NAME> has been removed. Use <name> instead.

rule.name: DMSSPEC
rule.description: <NAME> will be removed in a future release. Use <name> instead.

rule.name: DPSPEC
rule.description: <NAME> will be removed in a future release. Use <name> instead.

rule.name: DPPSD
rule.description: <NAME> will be removed in a future release. Use <name> instead.

rule.name: DINLN
rule.description: <NAME> will be removed in a future release. Use <name> instead.

rule.name: DFCNCHK
rule.description: <NAME> will be removed in a future release. Use <name> instead.

rule.name: MATCH2
rule.description: STRMATCH is not recommended. Use STRNCMP or VALIDATESTRING instead.

rule.name: MATCH3
rule.description: <NAME> is not recommended. Use <NAME> instead.

rule.name: GPUAR
rule.description: <NAME> has been removed. Use <name> instead.

rule.name: GPUARB
rule.description: parallel.gpu.GPUArray.<name> has been removed. Use gpuArray.<name> instead.

rule.name: CHLNC
rule.description: <NAME> has been removed. Use <NAME> instead.

rule.name: CHLNCI
rule.description: CHOLINC(X,'inf') has been removed. There is no simple replacement for this.

rule.name: BTSFT
rule.description: BITSHIFT(A,K,N) has been removed. Use BITSHIFT(A,K,ASSUMEDTYPE) instead.

rule.name: MTFA1
rule.description: MAKETFORM('AFFINE',A) is not recommended. Use AFFINE2D or AFFINE3D instead.

rule.name: MTFA2
rule.description: MAKETFORM('AFFINE',U,X) is not recommended. Use FITGEOTRANS instead.

rule.name: MTFP1
rule.description: MAKETFORM('PROJECTIVE',A) is not recommended. Use PROJECTIVE2D instead.

rule.name: MTFP2
rule.description: MAKETFORM('PROJECTIVE',U,X) is not recommended. Use FITGEOTRANS instead.

rule.name: MTFB
rule.description: MAKETFORM('BOX',...) is not recommended. Use IMREF2D or IMREF3D instead.

rule.name: MSYSTEM
rule.description: matlab.system.System will be removed in a future release. Use matlab.System instead.

rule.name: BTCMP
rule.description: BITCMP(A,N) has been removed. Use BITCMP(A,ASSUMEDTYPE) instead.

rule.name: CRTJOB
rule.description: <NAME> using zero inputs has been removed. Use a cluster object as the first input instead.

rule.name: PMTMCONF
rule.description: When using PMTM with three output arguments, the 'conflevel' input argument is recommended.

rule.name: ZEROLIKE
rule.description: Consider using <NAME>(..., 'like', X ) instead of <NAME>(..., class(X) ).

rule.name: NCHKI
rule.description: <NAME> will be removed in a future release. Use NARGINCHK instead.

rule.name: NCHKO
rule.description: <NAME> will be removed in a future release. Use NARGOUTCHK instead.

rule.name: NCHKN
rule.description: NARGCHK will be removed in a future release. Use NARGINCHK without ERROR instead.

rule.name: NCHKM
rule.description: NARGCHK will be removed in a future release. Use NARGOUTCHK without ERROR instead.

rule.name: NCHKNO
rule.description: NARGOUTCHK using more than two inputs will be removed in a future release. There is no simple replacement for this.

rule.name: NVREPL
rule.description: <NAME> is not recommended. Use <NAME> instead.

rule.name: GENDEP
rule.description: <NAME> will be removed in a future release. Use <NAME> instead.

rule.name: GENWARN
rule.description: <name> is not recommended.

rule.name: DEPCLG
rule.description: CLG has been removed. Use CLF instead.

rule.name: DEPBART
rule.description: sigwin.barthannwin is not recommended. Use BARTHANNWIN instead.

rule.name: DEPLETT
rule.description: sigwin.bartlett is not recommended. Use BARTLETT instead.

rule.name: FAFD
rule.description: farrow.fd will be removed in a future release. Use dfilt.farrowfd instead.

rule.name: FALFD
rule.description: farrow.linearfd will be removed in a future release. Use dfilt.farrowlinearfd instead.

rule.name: SQGPN
rule.description: seqgen.pn has been removed. Use comm.PNSequence instead.

rule.name: NORALG
rule.description: RandStream.RandnAlg will be removed in a future release. Use NormalTransform instead.

rule.name: SETRS
rule.description: RandStream.setDefaultStream has been removed. Use RandStream.setGlobalStream instead.

rule.name: GETRS
rule.description: RandStream.getDefaultStream has been removed. Use RandStream.getGlobalStream instead.

rule.name: DBLKMN
rule.description: sigwin.blackman is not recommended. Use BLACKMAN instead.

rule.name: DBHRRS
rule.description: sigwin.blackmanharris is not recommended. Use BLACKMANHARRIS instead.

rule.name: DBHMNWN
rule.description: sigwin.bohmanwin is not recommended. Use BOHMANWIN instead.

rule.name: DCHBWN
rule.description: sigwin.chebwin is not recommended. Use CHEBWIN instead.

rule.name: DFLTTPWN
rule.description: sigwin.flattopwin is not recommended. Use FLATTOPWIN instead.

rule.name: DGSWIN
rule.description: sigwin.gausswin is not recommended. Use GAUSSWIN instead.

rule.name: DHMMNG
rule.description: sigwin.hamming is not recommended. Use HAMMING instead.

rule.name: DHANN
rule.description: sigwin.hann is not recommended. Use HANN instead.

rule.name: DKSER
rule.description: sigwin.kaiser is not recommended. Use KAISER instead.

rule.name: DNLWN
rule.description: sigwin.nuttallwin is not recommended. Use NUTTALLWIN instead.

rule.name: DPNWN
rule.description: sigwin.parzenwin is not recommended. Use PARZENWIN instead.

rule.name: DRCTWN
rule.description: sigwin.rectwin is not recommended. Use RECTWIN instead.

rule.name: DTYLRWN
rule.description: sigwin.taylorwin is not recommended. Use TAYLORWIN instead.

rule.name: DTRNG
rule.description: sigwin.triang is not recommended. Use TRIANG instead.

rule.name: DTKYWN
rule.description: sigwin.tukeywin is not recommended. Use TUKEYWIN instead.

rule.name: DBURG
rule.description: spectrum.burg is not recommended. Use PBURG instead.

rule.name: DCOV
rule.description: spectrum.cov is not recommended. Use PCOV instead.

rule.name: DEVCTR
rule.description: spectrum.eigenvector is not recommended. Use PEIG instead.

rule.name: DMCOV
rule.description: spectrum.mcov is not recommended. Use PMCOV instead.

rule.name: DMTM
rule.description: spectrum.mtm is not recommended. Use PMTM instead.

rule.name: DMUSIC
rule.description: spectrum.music is not recommended. Use PMUSIC instead.

rule.name: DPRDGRM
rule.description: spectrum.periodogram is not recommended. Use PERIODOGRAM instead.

rule.name: DWELCH
rule.description: spectrum.welch is not recommended. Use PWELCH instead.

rule.name: DYULEAR
rule.description: spectrum.yulear is not recommended. Use PYULEAR instead.

rule.name: DPBCHNC
rule.description: fec.bchenc will be removed in a future release. Use comm.BCHEncoder instead.

rule.name: DBCHNC
rule.description: BCHENC has been removed. Use comm.BCHEncoder instead.

rule.name: DPBCHDC
rule.description: fec.bchdec will be removed in a future release. Use comm.BCHDecoder instead.

rule.name: DBCHDC
rule.description: BCHDEC has been removed. Use comm.BCHDecoder instead.

rule.name: DPRSNC
rule.description: fec.rsenc will be removed in a future release. Use comm.RSEncoder instead.

rule.name: DRSNC
rule.description: RSENC has been removed. Use comm.RSEncoder instead.

rule.name: DPRSDC
rule.description: fec.rsdec will be removed in a future release. Use comm.RSDecoder instead.

rule.name: DRSDC
rule.description: RSDEC has been removed. Use comm.RSDecoder instead.

rule.name: DLDPCNC
rule.description: fec.ldpcenc will be removed in a future release. Use comm.LDPCEncoder instead.

rule.name: DLDPCDC
rule.description: fec.ldpcdec will be removed in a future release. Use comm.LDPCDecoder instead.

rule.name: DEVM
rule.description: commmeasure.EVM is not recommended. Use comm.EVM instead.

rule.name: DMER
rule.description: commmeasure.MER is not recommended. Use comm.MER instead.

rule.name: DACPR
rule.description: commmeasure.ACPR is not recommended. Use comm.ACPR instead.

rule.name: DTRIREP
rule.description: TriRep will be removed in a future release. Use TRIANGULATION instead.

rule.name: DDELTRI
rule.description: DelaunayTri will be removed in a future release. Use delaunayTriangulation instead.

rule.name: DTRIINT
rule.description: TriScatteredInterp will be removed in a future release. Use scatteredInterpolant instead.

rule.name: DQUAD
rule.description: QUAD will be removed in a future release. Use INTEGRAL instead.

rule.name: DQUADL
rule.description: QUADL will be removed in a future release. Use INTEGRAL instead.

rule.name: DQUADV
rule.description: QUADV will be removed in a future release. Use INTEGRAL instead.

rule.name: DDBLQD
rule.description: DBLQUAD will be removed in a future release. Use INTEGRAL2 instead.

rule.name: DTRIQD
rule.description: TRIPLEQUAD will be removed in a future release. Use INTEGRAL3 instead.

rule.name: DAVIRD
rule.description: AVIREAD will be removed in a future release. Use VideoReader instead.

rule.name: DAVIINF
rule.description: AVIINFO will be removed in a future release. Use VideoReader instead.

rule.name: DAFINF
rule.description: AVIFINFO will be removed in a future release. Use VideoReader instead.

rule.name: DEXIFRD
rule.description: EXIFREAD has been removed. Use IMFINFO instead.

rule.name: DILEVAL
rule.description: INLINEEVAL will be removed in a future release. There is no simple replacement for this.

rule.name: DRNDINT
rule.description: RANDINT is not recommended. Use RANDI instead.

rule.name: DSTRRD
rule.description: STRREAD is not recommended. Use TEXTSCAN instead.

rule.name: DTXTRD
rule.description: TEXTREAD is not recommended. Use TEXTSCAN instead.

rule.name: DDTRD
rule.description: DATAREAD will be removed in a future release. Use TEXTSCAN instead.

rule.name: DFNDR
rule.description: findResource has been removed. Use PARCLUSTER instead.

rule.name: DCRTPJ
rule.description: createParallelJob has been removed. Use createCommunicatingJob instead.

rule.name: DCRTMJ
rule.description: createMatlabPoolJob has been removed. Use createCommunicatingJob instead.

rule.name: DDFEVL
rule.description: DFEVAL has been removed. Use BATCH instead.

rule.name: DDFEVLA
rule.description: DFEVALASYNC has been removed. Use BATCH instead.

rule.name: DDFTPC
rule.description: defaultParallelConfig has been removed. Use parallel.defaultClusterProfile instead.

rule.name: DIMTPC
rule.description: importParallelConfig has been removed. Use parallel.importProfile instead.

rule.name: DGCURJM
rule.description: getCurrentJobmanager has been removed. Use getCurrentCluster instead.

rule.name: DGFDEPD
rule.description: getFileDependencyDir has been removed. Use getAttachedFilesFolder instead.

rule.name: DWVRD
rule.description: WAVREAD has been removed. Use AUDIOREAD instead.

rule.name: DWVWR
rule.description: WAVWRITE has been removed. Use AUDIOWRITE instead.

rule.name: DWVFINF
rule.description: WAVFINFO has been removed. Use AUDIOINFO instead.

rule.name: DAURD
rule.description: AUREAD has been removed. Use AUDIOREAD instead.

rule.name: DAUFINF
rule.description: AUFINFO has been removed. Use AUDIOINFO instead.

rule.name: DAUWR
rule.description: AUWRITE has been removed. There is no simple replacement for this.

rule.name: DSTRRNG
rule.description: STR2RNG has been removed. There is no simple replacement for this.

rule.name: DWK1C
rule.description: WK1CONST has been removed. There is no simple replacement for this.

rule.name: DWK1RD
rule.description: WK1READ has been removed. There is no simple replacement for this.

rule.name: DWK1WR
rule.description: WK1WRITE has been removed. There is no simple replacement for this.

rule.name: DWK1FI
rule.description: WK1FINFO has been removed. There is no simple replacement for this.

rule.name: DWK1WRC
rule.description: WK1WREC has been removed. There is no simple replacement for this.

rule.name: DSTRMT
rule.description: STR2MAT is not recommended. Use CHAR instead.

rule.name: DSTSTR
rule.description: SETSTR is not recommended. Use CHAR instead.

rule.name: DSTRVCT
rule.description: STRVCAT is not recommended. Use CHAR instead.

rule.name: DISSTR
rule.description: ISSTR is not recommended. Use ISCHAR instead.

rule.name: DBLKPRC
rule.description: BLKPROC is not recommended. Use BLOCKPROC instead.

rule.name: DPGUPDLG
rule.description: PAGESETUPDLG will be removed in a future release. Use PRINTPREVIEW instead.

rule.name: DEMLC
rule.description: EMLC has been removed. Use CODEGEN instead.

rule.name: DEMLMEX
rule.description: EMLMEX has been removed. Use CODEGEN instead.

rule.name: DLUINC
rule.description: LUINC has been removed. Use ILU instead.

rule.name: DWVPLY
rule.description: WAVPLAY has been removed. Use AUDIOPLAYER instead.

rule.name: DWVREC
rule.description: WAVRECORD has been removed. Use AUDIORECORDER instead.

rule.name: DAVIFL
rule.description: AVIFILE has been removed. Use VideoWriter instead.

rule.name: DISEQN
rule.description: ISEQUALWITHEQUALNANS is not recommended. Use ISEQUALN instead.

rule.name: DAPPLUT
rule.description: APPLYLUT is not recommended. Use BWLOOKUP instead.

rule.name: DRSDEC
rule.description: RSDECOF has been removed. Use comm.RSDecoder instead.

rule.name: DRSENC
rule.description: RSENCOF has been removed. Use comm.RSEncoder instead.

rule.name: DMCHN
rule.description: MIMOCHAN will be removed in a future release. Use comm.MIMOChannel instead.

rule.name: DBITMAX
rule.description: BITMAX will be removed in a future release. Use FLINTMAX instead.

rule.name: DRCOSFIR
rule.description: RCOSFIR is not recommended. Use RCOSDESIGN instead.

rule.name: DRCOSFLT
rule.description: RCOSFLT is not recommended. Use RCOSDESIGN instead.

rule.name: DRCOSIIR
rule.description: RCOSIIR is not recommended. Use RCOSDESIGN instead.

rule.name: DRCOSINE
rule.description: RCOSINE is not recommended. Use RCOSDESIGN instead.

rule.name: DFIRRCOS
rule.description: FIRRCOS is not recommended. Use RCOSDESIGN instead.

rule.name: DFIRGAUSS
rule.description: FIRGAUSS is not recommended. Use GAUSSDESIGN instead.

rule.name: DGAUSSFIR
rule.description: GAUSSFIR is not recommended. Use GAUSSDESIGN instead.

rule.name: DVRML
rule.description: VRML has been removed. There is no simple replacement for this.

rule.name: DCSHELP
rule.description: CSHELP will be removed in a future release. There is no simple replacement for this.

rule.name: DFIGFLAG
rule.description: FIGFLAG will be removed in a future release. There is no simple replacement for this.

rule.name: DGETST
rule.description: GETSTATUS will be removed in a future release. There is no simple replacement for this.

rule.name: DMENUL
rule.description: MENULABEL will be removed in a future release. There is no simple replacement for this.

rule.name: DPOPUP
rule.description: POPUPSTR will be removed in a future release. There is no simple replacement for this.

rule.name: DUIGET
rule.description: UIGETTOOLBAR will be removed in a future release. There is no simple replacement for this.

rule.name: DNOANI
rule.description: NOANIMATE will be removed in a future release. There is no simple replacement for this.

rule.name: DGRDD
rule.description: GRIDDATA3 has been removed. Use GRIDDATA instead.

rule.name: DDELA
rule.description: DELAUNAY3 has been removed. Use DELAUNAY instead.

rule.name: DDSRCH
rule.description: DSEARCH has been removed. Use DelaunayTri/nearestNeighbor instead.

rule.name: DTSRCH
rule.description: TSEARCH has been removed. Use DelaunayTri/pointLocation instead.

rule.name: DPOOL
rule.description: MATLABPOOL will be removed in a future release. Use PARPOOL instead.

rule.name: DFLIPDIM
rule.description: FLIPDIM will be removed in a future release. Use FLIP instead.

rule.name: FSTR
rule.description: FINDSTR is not recommended. Use STRFIND instead.

rule.name: DDBMEX
rule.description: MEXDEBUG is not recommended. Use DBMEX instead.

rule.name: DFTSMTX
rule.description: FTS2MTX is not recommended. Use FTS2MAT instead.

rule.name: DIMTRNS
rule.description: IMTRANSFORM is not recommended. Use IMWARP instead.

rule.name: DCPTF
rule.description: CP2TFORM is not recommended. Use FITGEOTRANS instead.

rule.name: DEPNOE
rule.description: NUMBEROFELEMENTS is not recommended. Use NUMEL instead.

rule.name: DEPGENAM
rule.description: GENVARNAME will be removed in a future release. Use MATLAB.LANG.MAKEVALIDNAME and MATLAB.LANG.MAKEUNIQUESTRINGS instead.

rule.name: DEPFUN
rule.description: DEPFUN will be removed in a future release. Use matlab.codetools.requiredFilesAndProducts instead.

rule.name: MOVIE2
rule.description: MOVIE2AVI will be removed in a future release. Use VideoWriter instead.

rule.name: HDFGD
rule.description: HDFGD will be removed in a future release. Use matlab.io.hdfeos.gd instead.

rule.name: HDFSD
rule.description: HDFSD will be removed in a future release. Use matlab.io.hdfeos.sd instead.

rule.name: HDFSW
rule.description: HDFSW will be removed in a future release. Use matlab.io.hdfeos.sw instead.

rule.name: BINTP
rule.description: BINTPROG has been removed. Use INTLINPROG instead.

rule.name: ISGLOB
rule.description: ISGLOBAL will be removed in a future release. There is no simple replacement for this.
